title:
Representing Arbitrary Ground States of Toric Code by Restricted
  Boltzmann Machine
authors: Penghua Chen, Bowen Yan, and Shawn X. Cui
abstract:
We systematically analyze the representability of toric code ground states by
Restricted Boltzmann Machine with only local connections between hidden and
visible neurons. This analysis is pivotal for evaluating the model's capability
to represent diverse ground states, thus enhancing our understanding of its
strengths and weaknesses. Subsequently, we modify the Restricted Boltzmann
Machine to accommodate arbitrary ground states by introducing essential
non-local connections efficiently. The new model is not only analytically
solvable but also demonstrates efficient and accurate performance when solved
using machine learning techniques. Then we generalize our the model from $Z_2$
to $Z_n$ toric code and discuss future directions.
subjects: Condensed Matter/Disordered Systems and Neural Networks
